intro: Gymnelaea ligustrina, commonly known as the small-leaved nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows as a shrub with small, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to yellow or red as they mature. Gymnelaea ligustrina is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
